00023 /*! \file GRCFileWriter.h This file provides writing capaibilities for GRC files.
00024  */

00026 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00028 #include "file/1LQFileData.h"
00029 #include "file/GRCFileData.h"
00030 #include "file/GridControlData.h"
00031 //
00032 
00033 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00034 
00035 namespace affxgrc
00036 {
00037 
00038 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00039 
00040 /*! This class holds the coordinates of those probes used by the GCAST algorithm. */
00041 class CGRCFileWriter : public CGRCFileData
00042 {
00043 public:
00044         /*! Constructor
00045          */
00046         CGRCFileWriter();
00047 
00048         /*! Destructor
00049          */
00050         ~CGRCFileWriter();
00051 
00052         /*! Writes the contents of the file.
00053          * @param libData The data from a 1LQ file.
00054          * @param opposite The generated GRC File contains the reverse direction.
00055          * @return True if successful.
00056          */
00057         bool Write(const affx1lq::C1LQFileData &libData, bool opposite = false);
00058 
00059         /*! Writes the existing 1lq data to the grc file.
00060          * This method requires that this class be populated with 1LQ File Data before it can be
00061          *    invoked (To poluate 1LQ file, you must first call PopulateData or 
00062          *    Write(const affx1lq::C1LQFileData &libData,..) method).
00063          * @param opposite The generated GRC File contains the reverse direction.
00064          * @return True if successful.
00065          */
00066         bool Write(bool opposite = false);
00067 
00068         /*! Populate the class with 1LQ file data.
00069          * @param libData The data from a 1LQ file.
00070          */
00071         void PopulateData(const affx1lq::C1LQFileData &libData);
00072 
00073         /*! Sets the number of rows.
00074          * @param rows The number of rows.
00075          */
00076         void SetRows(int rows) { m_Grid.SetRows(rows); }
00077 
00078         /*! Sets the number of columns.
00079          * @param columns The number of columns.
00080          */
00081         void SetColumns(int columns) { m_Grid.SetColumns(columns); }
00082 
00083         /*! Resizes the B1 array.
00084          * @param size The size of the array.
00085          */
00086         void ResizeB1(int size) { m_Grid.ResizeB1(size); }
00087 
00088         /*! Resizes the B2 array.
00089          * @param size The size of the array.
00090          */
00091         void ResizeB2(int size) { m_Grid.ResizeB2(size); }
00092 
00093         /*! Resizes the NS array.
00094          * @param size The size of the array.
00095          */
00096         void ResizeNS(int size) { m_Grid.ResizeNS(size); }
00097 
00098         /*! Sets the B1 probe at the given index.
00099          * @param index The index of the array.
00100          * @param coord The new coordinate.
00101          */
00102         void SetB1(int index, int x, int y);
00103 
00104         /*! Sets the B2 probe at the given index.
00105          * @param index The index of the array.
00106          * @param coord The new coordinate.
00107          */
00108         void SetB2(int index, int x, int y);
00109 
00110         /*! Sets the NS probe at the given index.
00111          * @param index The index of the array.
00112          * @param coord The new coordinate.
00113          */
00114         void SetNS(int index, int x, int y);
00115 
00116 protected:
00117         /*! The GRC file object. */
00118         affymetrix_grid_control::GridControlData m_Grid;
00119 
00120         /*! Parses the data from the 1LQ object.
00121          * @param libData The data from a 1LQ file.
00122          */
00123         void ParseLibData(const affx1lq::C1LQFileData &libData);
00124 
00125         /*! Writes the existing data to the GRC file
00126          * @param opposite The generated GRC File contains the reverse direction.
00127          * @return True if successful.
00128          */
00129         bool WriteFile(bool opposite = false);
00130 
00131 };
